messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] kids chat?
messages.msgSnippet: Has she tried the kids message boards at unschooling.com?  Dagny s 10, and she likes them.  If she d like to talk to Dagny, let me know. She s always looking
messages.messageBody:
Has she tried the kids' message boards at unschooling.com? Dagny's 10, and
she likes them. If she'd like to talk to Dagny, let me know. She's always
looking for more unschooled kids :0). ~Rue

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] kids chat?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/5/2003 9:37:47 PM Mountain Daylight Time, nellebelle@charter.net writes: I will need to do some research on how AOL interacts with other
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/5/2003 9:37:47 PM Mountain Daylight Time,
nellebelle@... writes:
I will need to do some research on how AOL interacts with other chats. We
have a "trial" with AOL, so that would work for her.
If you don't cancel out before the month is over, they'll charge you, I
think.

Others can get a free AIM account if they want. I've set them up when
visiting friends and its pretty easy to do!

I think it's at aol.com.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] kids chat?
messages.msgSnippet: I told Lisa that some kids with parents on the unschoolingdiscussion list were interested in chatting or IMing, and she is really excited. We are usually home
messages.messageBody:
I told Lisa that some kids with parents on the unschoolingdiscussion list were interested in chatting or IMing, and she is really excited.

We are usually home on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday mornings, so she could be on-line anytime during 9-12 am Pacific time.

Would anyone else like to choose an hour or so from that window, and those interested could do a chat this week?

I will need to do some research on how AOL interacts with other chats. We have a "trial" with AOL, so that would work for her. Can folks outside of AOL join in too?

I can help her set it up if even one other person is interested in that time frame, but more could be even more fun.

Mary Ellen

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] kids chat?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/5/03 12:53:14 PM, nellebelle@charter.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/5/03 12:53:14 PM, nellebelle@... writes:

<< My 10yod is interested in doing on-line chatting. Are there any unschool
kid chats? Or even relaxed homeschool kid chats? >>

If she has AOL or AIM, and if she wants to pick a time, others could probably
join her. Marty and Holly might be interested. They can both get on at the
same time. She would need to have the addresses of the people (or they would
need hers) so she could invite them into a private chatroom.

As to online chats in pre-existing places, outside AOL I don't know how it
works.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] kids chat?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/5/03 02:54:18 PM Central Daylight Time, skreams@comcast.net writes: Has she tried the kids message boards at unschooling.com?  Dagny s
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/5/03 02:54:18 PM Central Daylight Time,
skreams@... writes:
Has she tried the kids' message boards at unschooling.com? Dagny's 10, and
she likes them. If she'd like to talk to Dagny, let me know. She's always
looking for more unschooled kids :0). ~Rue
#####################################

And Moly is nine, almost ten, and she is always looking for other kids to
chat or email with. She often emails Sandra's daughter, who has never met Moly
IRL, but always responds, and Moly loves that! So if she wants, I will post
Moly's email too.
~Nancy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] kids chat?
messages.msgSnippet: my son, Erik is 10, if she would like to talk. I am a believer in unschooling, but he asks for lessons all the time. so I bought an online program to use
messages.messageBody:
my son, Erik is 10, if she would like to talk. I am a believer in
unschooling, but he asks for "lessons' all the time. so I bought an online program to use
when he wants his history or science lesson. i dont know if that makes him an
schooler and me an unschooler.??? when he asks to make up his own lesson, i
always back away. i figure he will give up his lessons eventually, or take them
over himself some day.

Susan in FLA
Mom 2 3 boys


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] kids chat?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Alex has a lot of online buddies from NeoPets, on Yahoo! Messenger.  He s 9, btw.  He s always looking for new chat buddies, maybe they could get together
messages.messageBody:
nellebelle@... writes:
> My 10yod is interested in doing on-line chatting. Are there any unschool
> kid chats? Or even relaxed homeschool kid chats? She tried Homeschool Kids
> Around the World, but most of the kids there are heavily "curriculumated". I
> don't know if she would qualify for the new unschool teen list, as she isn't
> quite a teen.
>
> Mary Ellen

Alex has a lot of online buddies from NeoPets, on Yahoo! Messenger. He's 9,
btw. He's always looking for new chat buddies, maybe they could get together
online. Email me off list?

Oh, and he likes the Unschooling Message Board, she could meet people there.
There's a kid page.

~Aimee


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: kids chat?
messages.msgSnippet: My 10yod is interested in doing on-line chatting.  Are there any unschool kid chats?  Or even relaxed homeschool kid chats?  She tried Homeschool Kids Around
messages.messageBody:
My 10yod is interested in doing on-line chatting. Are there any unschool kid chats? Or even relaxed homeschool kid chats? She tried Homeschool Kids Around the World, but most of the kids there are heavily "curriculumated". I don't know if she would qualify for the new unschool teen list, as she isn't quite a teen.

Mary Ellen

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
